alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 10 at 3:08PM EST until January 11 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero expected very late tonight til mid morning Tuesday. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, Interior DownEast and Penobscot Valley Maine. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon EST Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 15 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis
